Author: jyrzyk
Content:
"What seems to have worked best for cultures is to play off the men against each other, competing for respect and other rewards that end up distributed very unequally. Men have to prove themselves by producing things the society values."

"Make something people want."

Author: hhm
Title: Hacker news? maybe that's not going to attract all the interesting classic redittors...
Content:
What about those who wouldn't consider themselves "hackers" (even if they are, for the hacker encyclopedia). I'm speaking, for example, about scientists of all kind, artists, writers, etc. Real life hackers, but also hackers that wouldn't know that hacking isn't about programming but about a way to deal with knowledge.

Are they just going to stay in Reddit, wouldn't it be better if those came to the "hacker news" too?

Author: motoko
Content: Is this supposed to be irony? What is this poorly written rambling doing on "Hacker News?"

Author: daniel-cussen
Title: Ideally, how long should a submission be?
Content: A lot of the time, I'm looking for bite-sized clips, and get 11-page monstrosities.  Sometimes things work out the other way around.  How long should the ideal post be?  Would it be good to show it's length?

Author: nickb
Content:
The paper you linked is behind a paywall :(

Here's a free version from the author himself:

Paper: http://www.faculty.idc.ac.il/arik/imret.pdf

Hi-rez video: http://www.faculty.idc.ac.il/arik/IMRet-All.mov

PS: This stuff is probably in the process of getting patented. Adobe will have to license it. Few years back Adobe got into a lot of trouble for "stealing" healing brush from one guy. He sued them and I think they settled.

Author: alex_c
Content:
But that won't cause anyone to change their behaviour. Troublemakers will only see "warnings" as a sign that there are no consequences, and won't believe they'll get kicked out until it does happen. There has to be a middle ground between no punishment (warning) and getting kicked out.

You can't just explain abstract consequences to a kid and expect them to react the same way as a rational adult. Some might, most won't.

Author: bmaier
Title: News.YC Library
Content:
Piggybacking on the recent Where to Start Programming and Hacker School Threads... What texts and works do you feel are essential and should be a part of every hackers library.

Looking for books and also free online material. Any topic from strict programming texts to more abstract works.

I'll start:

Church-Turing Thesis: http://plato.stanford.edu/entries/church-turing/
